Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; BURNED, OXIDIZED; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Bottle
Description: An ovoidal receptacle with a narrow mouth and a small high circular neck with a slightly projecting collar, decorated on the outside with striations, and a convex base. The surface of the piece is reddish in colour and in the upper third part is a band of a white colour with decoration of semicircular black lines. This band is framed by two painted black lines above four grooves made with the potter's wheel.
